trans-unit.source: Azure Portal
trans-unit.target: Azure Portal

trans-unit.source: Azure Preview Portal
trans-unit.target: Azure Preview Portal

trans-unit.source: You can configure the most commonly used settings for a cloud service in the Azure Management Portal.
trans-unit.target: You can configure the most commonly used settings for a cloud service in the Azure Management Portal.

trans-unit.source: Or, if you like to update your configuration files directly, download a service configuration file to update, and then upload the updated file and update the cloud service with the configuration changes.
trans-unit.target: Or, if you like to update your configuration files directly, download a service configuration file to update, and then upload the updated file and update the cloud service with the configuration changes.

trans-unit.source: Either way, the configuration updates are pushed out to all role instances.
trans-unit.target: Either way, the configuration updates are pushed out to all role instances.

trans-unit.source: The Azure Management Portal also allows you to [enable Remote Desktop Connection for a Role in Azure Cloud Services](cloud-services-role-enable-remote-desktop.md)
trans-unit.target: The Azure Management Portal also allows you to [enable Remote Desktop Connection for a Role in Azure Cloud Services](cloud-services-role-enable-remote-desktop.md)

trans-unit.source: Azure can only ensure 99.95 percent service availability during the configuration updates if you have at least two role instances for every role.
trans-unit.target: Azure can only ensure 99.95 percent service availability during the configuration updates if you have at least two role instances for every role.

trans-unit.source: That enables one virtual machine to process client requests while the other is being updated.
trans-unit.target: That enables one virtual machine to process client requests while the other is being updated.

trans-unit.source: Change a cloud service
trans-unit.target: Change a cloud service

trans-unit.source: In the [Azure Portal](http://manage.windowsazure.com/), click **Cloud Services**, click the name of the cloud service, and then click **Configure**.
trans-unit.target: In the [Azure Portal](http://manage.windowsazure.com/), click **Cloud Services**, click the name of the cloud service, and then click **Configure**.

trans-unit.source: Configuration Page
trans-unit.target: Configuration Page

trans-unit.source: On the **Configure** page, you can configure monitoring, update role settings, and choose the guest operating system and family for role instances.
trans-unit.target: On the **Configure** page, you can configure monitoring, update role settings, and choose the guest operating system and family for role instances.

trans-unit.source: In **monitoring**, set the monitoring level to Verbose or Minimal, and configure the diagnostics connection strings that are required for verbose monitoring.
trans-unit.target: In **monitoring**, set the monitoring level to Verbose or Minimal, and configure the diagnostics connection strings that are required for verbose monitoring.

trans-unit.source: For service roles (grouped by role), you can update the following settings:
trans-unit.target: For service roles (grouped by role), you can update the following settings:

trans-unit.source: **Settings**
trans-unit.target: **Settings**

trans-unit.source: Modify the values of miscellaneous configuration settings that are specified in the *ConfigurationSettings* elements of the service configuration (.cscfg) file.
trans-unit.target: Modify the values of miscellaneous configuration settings that are specified in the *ConfigurationSettings* elements of the service configuration (.cscfg) file.

trans-unit.source: **Certificates**
trans-unit.target: **Certificates**

trans-unit.source: Change the certificate thumbprint that's being used in SSL encryption for a role.
trans-unit.target: Change the certificate thumbprint that's being used in SSL encryption for a role.

trans-unit.source: To change a certificate, you must first upload the new certificate (on the **Certificates** page).
trans-unit.target: To change a certificate, you must first upload the new certificate (on the **Certificates** page).

trans-unit.source: Then update the thumbprint in the certificate string displayed in the role settings.
trans-unit.target: Then update the thumbprint in the certificate string displayed in the role settings.

trans-unit.source: In **operating system**, you can change the operating system family or version for role instances, or choose **Automatic** to enable automatic updates of the current operating system version.
trans-unit.target: In **operating system**, you can change the operating system family or version for role instances, or choose **Automatic** to enable automatic updates of the current operating system version.

trans-unit.source: The operating system settings apply to web roles and worker roles, but do not affect Virtual Machines.
trans-unit.target: The operating system settings apply to web roles and worker roles, but do not affect Virtual Machines.

trans-unit.source: During deployment, the most recent operating system version is installed on all role instances, and the operating systems are updated automatically by default.
trans-unit.target: During deployment, the most recent operating system version is installed on all role instances, and the operating systems are updated automatically by default.

trans-unit.source: If you need for your cloud service to run on a different operating system version because of compatibility requirements in your code, you can choose an operating system family and version.
trans-unit.target: If you need for your cloud service to run on a different operating system version because of compatibility requirements in your code, you can choose an operating system family and version.

trans-unit.source: When you choose a specific operating system version, automatic operating system updates for the cloud service are suspended.
trans-unit.target: When you choose a specific operating system version, automatic operating system updates for the cloud service are suspended.

trans-unit.source: You will need to ensure the operating systems receive updates.
trans-unit.target: You will need to ensure the operating systems receive updates.

trans-unit.source: If you resolve all compatibility issues that your apps have with the most recent operating system version, you can enable automatic operating system updates by setting the operating system version to **Automatic**.
trans-unit.target: If you resolve all compatibility issues that your apps have with the most recent operating system version, you can enable automatic operating system updates by setting the operating system version to **Automatic**.

trans-unit.source: OS Settings
trans-unit.target: OS Settings

trans-unit.source: To save your configuration settings, and push them to the role instances, click **Save**.
trans-unit.target: To save your configuration settings, and push them to the role instances, click **Save**.

trans-unit.source: (Click **Discard** to cancel the changes.) **Save** and **Discard** are added to the command bar after you change a setting.
trans-unit.target: (Click **Discard** to cancel the changes.) **Save** and **Discard** are added to the command bar after you change a setting.

trans-unit.source: Update a cloud service configuration file
trans-unit.target: Update a cloud service configuration file

trans-unit.source: Download a cloud service configuration file (.cscfg) with the current configuration.
trans-unit.target: Download a cloud service configuration file (.cscfg) with the current configuration.

trans-unit.source: On the **Configure** page for the cloud service, click **Download**.
trans-unit.target: On the **Configure** page for the cloud service, click **Download**.

trans-unit.source: Then click **Save**, or click **Save As** to save the file.
trans-unit.target: Then click **Save**, or click **Save As** to save the file.

trans-unit.source: After you update the service configuration file, upload and apply the configuration updates:
trans-unit.target: After you update the service configuration file, upload and apply the configuration updates:

trans-unit.source: On the **Configure** page, click **Upload**.
trans-unit.target: On the **Configure** page, click **Upload**.

trans-unit.source: Upload Configuration
trans-unit.target: Upload Configuration

trans-unit.source: In **Configuration file**, use **Browse** to select the updated .cscfg file.
trans-unit.target: In **Configuration file**, use **Browse** to select the updated .cscfg file.

trans-unit.source: If your cloud service contains any roles that have only one instance, select the **Apply configuration even if one or more roles contain a single instance** check box to enable the configuration updates for the roles to proceed.
trans-unit.target: If your cloud service contains any roles that have only one instance, select the **Apply configuration even if one or more roles contain a single instance** check box to enable the configuration updates for the roles to proceed.

trans-unit.source: Unless you define at least two instances of every role, Azure cannot guarantee at least 99.95 percent availability of your cloud service during service configuration updates.
trans-unit.target: Unless you define at least two instances of every role, Azure cannot guarantee at least 99.95 percent availability of your cloud service during service configuration updates.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Service Level Agreements](http://azure.microsoft.com/support/legal/sla/).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Service Level Agreements](http://azure.microsoft.com/support/legal/sla/).

trans-unit.source: Click **OK** (checkmark).
trans-unit.target: Click **OK** (checkmark).
